headline: Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL) Valuation Revisited As Analyst Optimism And Sector Rotation Gain Pace
summary: Recent analyst reports and investment commentary have put Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL) back in focus, as brokers and asset managers point to its service levels, cost control, and position in the less than truckload market. See our latest analysis for Old Dominion Freight Line. Those upbeat broker comments arrive after a strong run in the share price, with a 30 day share price return of 11.60% and a 90 day gain of 21.68%. However, the latest 1 year total shareholder return is a 6.67%...

headline: Is It Too Late To Reconsider Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL) After Mixed Share Price Performance
summary: If you have been wondering whether Old Dominion Freight Line shares are offering fair value right now, you are not alone. This article focuses squarely on what the current price might be implying. The stock closed at US$175.65 recently, with returns of 1.2% over the last 7 days, 11.6% over the last 30 days, 10.3% year to date, a 6.7% decline over 1 year, 10.6% over 3 years, and 70.4% over 5 years. This gives a mixed picture for anyone thinking about risk and opportunity. Recent coverage of...

headline: What Catalysts Are Rewriting The Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL) Story For 2026 And Beyond
summary: Why the Fair Value Estimate Has Shifted The fair value estimate for Old Dominion Freight Line has moved from about US$155.92 to about US$167.17, with the model now using a slightly higher discount rate of about 7.88% and a lower revenue growth assumption of about 4.92%. This reflects a tug of war between analysts who highlight potential support from tighter trucking capacity and infrastructure driven freight demand, and those who focus on ongoing softness in freight activity and earnings...

headline: Is Cluster of Bullish Analyst Notes on Service Quality Altering The Investment Case For Old Dominion Freight Line (ODFL)?
summary: In recent days, multiple research firms including Truist, Evercore ISI, Barclays, and Wedgewood Partners have reiterated confidence in Old Dominion Freight Line, emphasizing its dependable less-than-truckload service, strong cost control, and ongoing investments despite freight-market uncertainty. This cluster of upbeat commentary highlights Old Dominion’s reputation for premium service quality, such as very high on-time performance and low freight damage, as a key differentiator that is...
